parent_comment: Not more chemicals, but a very specific chemical (and, presumably, a brand). Round-Up is considerably less toxic than the alternatives. To humans it's not toxic (it's an irritant to skin and eyes, and will upset your stomach if you drink it) -- it has no exposure threshold limit, and there's no record of any toxicity from prolonged exposure by those handling it (other than asthma attacks from those that inhale it in aerosol form). It also degrades VERY rapidly when exposed to air and sunlight. That said, it can be pretty hazardous in immediate run-off, and it's usually mixed with surfactants and carrier solutions that are potentially more environmentally detrimental. Even then, though, it's probably the least toxic synthetic chemical used in modern agriculture (to humans), and, if deployed properly, probably of negligible importance to the environment (particularly on very large farms).
